dCYNdgBJC3HNen6RVq5IvQ.text: I think it's kind of understood now, YAFO's food tastes AMAZING. however, the staff at the central location is anything but. I use to visit the Yafo location in South Park like once a week. Chicken shawarma wrap. They do the wrap PERFECTLY. And BIG! Save your money at central, get a bowl, because the wrap is not worth your cash. And calling in an order, you can forget that being right. I love Yafo but I hate going to the central location.

_utvAiEu6e7QSK8XCTYOQw.text: Yummy food, efficient service, the staff was very personal and went out of their way to make sure we were happy, and it was so clean! The manager does a great job!

XQcN_yXiT_4hTTIrJpboNA.text: Want to feel like you're in a cafeteria from high school? This is your spot to feel that way. We've enjoyed the South Park location.  So we were excited to try this location.  The staff was atrocious with zero personality.  The food was skimped on but good. We weren't even asked if we wanted drinks. My overall suggestion is bring staff from Southpark or just go to that location.

Y34M_i0ArOhISbUxJJ6Fvg.text: This is a massage of praise! I just left your Yafo Plaza Midwood location and was so impressed with your staffs customer service! From the moment I arrived I was greeted with smiles and everyone's eagerness to help! Not the mention the food was delicious! Excellent job! Such a pleasant place :)

cvy8b-UIxlHsCr9uIB24mw.text: First time at Yafo tonight and it was delicious. Lady K did great with awesome customer service skills.

t21etpGGVW84yJ8Kf64Ipw.text: The food is delicious. I frequent this location at least once a week. A bonus for me is running into Kamesha (employee), she has the best personality. She's very knowledgeable in regards to the menu and she always delivers excellent service. Glen (the manager) is also pleasant..I prefer this location over south park l.

AYTprqduCfoLZCrUZuOJpA.text: We walked in, looked at the prep station and walked right out. It was a mess. It wasn't busy, nor was it a time of day that they just finished a rush.

1s9UjsQVvhwPShEzPyFCZg.text: Unbelievable.. reminds me of authentic Israeli cuisine with a modern twist.. finally a place with the REAL falafel..

orwhI4NaeQTmBFM6SX5Hxg.text: If you've been to the location in Southpark, you know what you're getting out of this place - excellent food!  The Plaza Midwood location is fantastic and a welcome addition to the neighborhood food scene.  I highly recommend you check it out.

uzEq9iFJkdYMZ97WzMANEQ.text: Good place good drinks I recommend getting a kids meal if you don't feel like eating in entire bowl or just don't eat big servings like me I recommend mixing the rice and salad together instead of a plain rice bowl or a plain salad bowl

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mango tea
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kids chicken rice bowl

NppQwASM3i-lO3cpSaKo6w.text: This place is awesome, very up and coming.  The service here is excellent, the staff really do a great job.  The food is fantastic, I have just done the bowls so far and they have not disappointed.  The detail in each of the items you can add to the bowl is amazing. The food is so fresh, they smoke their meats and make fresh bread right on site.  This place is great for all dietary constraints and allergies, they're very accommodating. Overall, I have been very impressed with the place and cannot wait to go back!

b-Yl4dBVbZscPfol98lZ8A.text: Great health choice, good food, decent price and good customer service. Waited a while to have a location near by and haven't been disappointed.

IC-FuO2ddO8ma3I-6uo2Wg.text: Kind of pricey, kind of cold, kind of ok staff, really tasty though.  The best Mediterranean in Midwood that I know of. Reminds me of Chipotle.

jR6smQ40cr4ZKtVzctkcqw.text: Amazing food with big portions. The staff and manager were very friendly and helpful navigating through the menu. Will definitely come back again.

9TOWUGIWsnFN5EJb8SZLvA.text: I had an amazing experience at Yafo. Both locations are great, but I love this new locations feel. The staff is great and made amazing recommendations and helped guide me as I tried things I haven't tried before. People swooped by and helped us at our table lightning fast and the service after getting our food was even above our expectations. We loved it. It was busy at lunch time and I was impressed by how they were able to answer my questions but get me through the line quickly. And the food was amazing, and loved the staff. Very clean place, with fresh food and I always feel like I'm getting quality ingredients. Lots of care must go into running this place. You would not know they are a new opening! Great team.

QDxYCIayElEO_WmqjsZTNQ.text: LOVE THE FALAFEL! must try! Line gets long around lunch & you can customize your own dish. Good sides

5vhNB22-kUHNao9YksTKeg.text: I love the bowls... and the items you add are the quintessential and perfect dish of superb taste!! I had the roasted potatoes and cauliflower with tahini.. I got my husband to try it and he is now a "Yafonian" !!!

8Shm01-L0TxQYEbTvbp4JQ.text: I am a huge yafo fan so when this location opened up I had to give them a try to see if they were up to par like the southpark location. They definitely were & the food never disappoints! I'm so glad to see them expanding & can't wait for their 3rd location in dilworth!

498zDSWp2J5uhJ_Bg20aqQ.text: Great food, great feeling place! Portions were great for the price and being able to customize it means I can come back and not get tired of the same old order. Service was quick and friendly. I was able to eat enough to feel full (with some leftover to take home) without feeling like I ate too much.

C6oZlcR6_xfmqTukPXx8cA.text: The build your own bowl is everything. The Cauliflower and the lemon sauce really hit the spot!

ii2LK6U3rSDxN04NSjUnrQ.text: Great place! I love Greek food and I've been craving it for a while. So I decide to check this place out because of all its reviews and it did not disappoint. I got a rice bowl with spring mix. I got the lamb with falafel for extra. I think the portion size is great. The ingredients were fresh and so well seasoned. Overall, a great place for a quick bite. They also have 3 different sauces for free!! How can you beat that?!

CpgPbVWJaE97WDphzMf6lg.text: What a wonderful combination of food and customer service.  They are so attentive and make you feel like you just walked into your neighborhood food place.  They make everyone relaxed and happy.  The food was delicious!  Perfect balance of flavors.  Hummus was fresh and yummy pitas.    Loved the large selection of drinks as well.  We will be stopping in anytime we are in the area.

jQNciX-1AhwZR_YGk9YHwg.text: Super fast and tasty. So happy to have a different vegetarian and takeout option in the neighborhood.

cDS66MS-UkwsPBkQL4vtdA.text: The food is delicious. It's fresh and tastes soooo good. However, I did take away one star because the ordering process gave me anxiety. It's similar to that of chipotle or subway etc and the music is kind of loud and they are behind a tall glass and I'm pretty short so I had to be the person who asked "what" 7 times. They didn't really want to explain what anything was and I wanted to ask for recommendations and specifics but they just seemed to want to get me through the line. Not to mention the tzatziki portion they give you is really small so I ended up asking for three. A very nice bus boy kept checking on us and was so sweet and accommodating. I probably wouldn't have given it 4 stars if his customer service had sucked. That's pretty much it. Want to come back at a less busy time, will definitely be back for food. Also there is parking.

yqJpIkrFUdPZRRV0sXR2Vw.text: We order from here regularly and the food is always great. It's like a Mediterranean Chipotle, but a billion times better. I have a soy allergy and only one item on their menu contains soy (one of the dressings), so I love that I can order just about anything on the menu without modification.

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

eKi2Sel5mMEPVH4_9AmhQw.text: The food you get at Yafo is excellent. Best mediterranean chain period.  We've been a few times - service was great every time.

u4ZJhktj_1OJ365cqpR_Kw.text: Pretty much amazing. Food is awesome and the chief is very friendly and welcoming. Lots of choices for even the pickiest eater.   Ordering is a little confusing. I wish they would also have two sizes of bowls or pay by the pound.   Just advice to lunch break people, don't send one person with 10 orders. Extremely annoying and frankly rude.

lhf42zGrkyNwcAZ6zf2cnw.text: I LOVE the food at Yafo. It always tastes great, and there are many options for people who don't eat bread...  However, I am disappointed in the service. My first visit I had no clue what I was doing, and no one helped me understand. I ended up with a salad. It was ok, mostly because I don't want to eat a salad at a restaurant. As I walked further, I saw all the sides (mezzes, but how am I supposed to know that on my first time?) and I was disappointed in my choice. The next time, I knew better, and wow, the chicken was delicious and the Brussel sprouts, cauliflower, and potatoes were amazing. The falafel are some of the best I've ever had.  The service could be better, as in help a girl out to get the good stuff! Also, when ordering online, don't bother putting a time in. They disregard it. I would also check your food when you pick it up. I did not get the white meat I paid a dollar extra for.  Like I said, the food is excellent! Just some things to be aware of as far as making sure the get what you want!

lma5YoXV6oKnMhuSHIrwvQ.text: Yafo is a great fast casual Mediterranean spot. Probably the best in my opinion.  Staff is super nice and helpful and they keep the line moving quickly and efficiently. Ordered a bowl with lamb and my friend had the chicken. Both were extremely good and we were thoroughly impressed. Got a side of falafel as well as the greek yogurt mac and cheese. If you come here you are absolutely doing it wrong if you dont order the mac and cheese. And if you simply dont like mac and cheese dont read my reviews because I dont trust you and you probably wont trust me. Anyways yafo gets 5 stars for not only the food but for the overall experience.  Thanks for coming to plaza guys.

My-gONzDn1fiJiIdpVdbng.text: Fantastic food and stellar customer service!  Got the shawarma wrap and also a BYO bowl and both were packed with flavor. Brussels sprouts are a great side as well. Plus, the cost!  Two entrees, two 12 oz cans of wine, plus tip, under $50 for two people!  Multiples times we were asked if we need anything else (more water, sauces, etc). Really great customer service which goes a long way. Keep up the good work!

X_HM46vCzaGk1GC_XyFJtA.text: I have visited this location twice now wnd the food is pretty consistent. The service the second time was outstanding. Glenn greeted us as we came through the door, checked on during our meal, and invited us back as we were leaving. Andy prepared my husband's bowl with the way he eats it, and my husband was very happy with Andy's  bowl choice. I love the freshness snd lightness if the meal. I am left full without feeling sluggish. I especially enjoy the mango tea mixed with love potion. This is also the only place I will eat Brussel sprouts. I don't know what they do to them here, but they are outstanding. The macaroni and cheeses was impressive; I didn't expect it to be creamy or al dente. It was both. Thanks for a great experience guys!

8k_1_F-IM8ZUbRnWIaFqWQ.text: I've been to YAFO in SouthPark and  Park Road - every time with great experiences. Great chicken and service.  However, I've given the Plaza Midwood location 3x and will not be returning.  If you want a "bowl" at the PM location, you'll be fine.  Seems like this is the most popular choice here. If you want a full "family meal", you'll probably have issues -again, only seems to be a problem in PM. The first time we ordered a family meal, we got home to discover chicken slices and pieces in the to-go box, second time, the server and management was confused with what exactly a "family meal" was and the sides with it, the third(and last time) they understood what the meal consisted of(YAY!) but didn't have a full chicken without a 30 minute wait.  This was revealed AT THE REGISTER.   If you want a simple bowl...go.  If you want a consistent product with a family style chicken option, go to SouthPark or Dilworth or, better yet, go to Viva Chicken in Elizabeth. You won't be disappointed.  Get it together, PM YAFO.

buUQP1W6zYrKDd-7MRvzsA.text: Interesting,  mostly healthy food.  I ordered the chef special pork belly gyro.  Very salty.  I think it would have all worked well together but the salt was overwhelming.   The beets were great.  I will try it again and hopefully not get a salt shaker full of salt.

uRqIB9W5lBbbu4LwNcn6kg.text: New favorite spot. It's like Chipotle, but with more options and friendlier staff. They give you a ton of food for the price, the bowls end up being 2-3 full meals for me. The quality of ingredients is fantastic, and the sauces are great. Recommend the chickpea salad, falafel, roasted cauliflower, lemon tahini and chug.

VxHmFGju9cqrhnq2XOcXeQ.text: LOVE Yafo! We are there at least once a week, think of this amazing spot as Chipotle ON CRACK! ;) It's clean, delicious and fairly quick to get through the cafeteria style line. Even when it's crazy crowded the line doesn't take more than 10 min which is MUCH LESS time than you'd wait at a sit down restaurant! The regular choices vs premium/upcharged choices aren't a huge difference for me personally but just know that each is a $1 upcharge (it adds up quickly )! The staff is usually friendly, they are human though so don't pitch a fit if one person doesn't want to have a full blown conversation with you about your day... they see hundreds of people - ain't nobody got time for all that! LOVE the teas and other drinks, try them all - you'll thank me!

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

XavnEsKalE-J_1wWUCOv2A.text: Nice refreshing concept.  A great alternative to fast food.  Quality ingredients made in a variety of Middle Eastern styles with many vegetarian options.  I like the "build your own" options that allows you to combine just about all the ingredients the way you want.  We got the Falafel and Greek wraps.  Both were good.  The mezze options are also tasty.  The tabouleh is particularly good.  Ordered a salad bowl with eggplant.  It was OK.  My only complain is that too many items are mixed together in a relatively small bowl so that the tastes get all mixed up.  Variety of condiments and home made drinks are also great.

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. So I&#39;ll know where I am
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice system
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. That&#39;s where everything starts

ZEfYwpDs3Mj49lQdONhNNQ.text: Even though I like Cava better, Yafo Kitchen is a great competitor. Fresh, fast, healthy. The staff could be a bit more friendlier to consumers especially when you let them know you usually eat Cava and it's your first time trying Yafo. Everyone I asked for recommendation seemed like they didn't like the menu options. I did the make your own bowl and some of my lamb meat was hanging of the bowl. The lady went to close with the top and meat juice was all in bag. The love potion is pretty damn good, it'a must try.

N5zuU0g_-ga8lpF3nB_QoA.text: I liked this place before.  But over time you get bored. Nothing special but a regular eat out. The rice and falafel is too dry at times.  The wraps are better than the bowls.

HJoVJFMbjM3mmKnWpdEZ3w.text: I'm sad to say that this location does not live up to the south park location's perfection. The line is slow, the staff are disorganized and don't handle the crowd near as efficiently as the other location. For one the takeout bowls changed and you get far less food than the original takeout bowls, also, it didn't indicate anywhere on the menu that the beef took 5 minutes to cook and were told this after I had already paid for our bowls. After the line, we of course didn't want to wait so missed out on it. I know it just opened, but overall this location needs some major work to live up to the south park location. I hope that the owners aren't stretching themselves too thin with location openings to make sure that quality service, food, and customer experience is being delivered. First unsatisfactory yafo experience, just go to the south park location. UPDATE: we got home and our chicken is COLD, not even room temp, ice cold. Honestly don't know if I'll be frequenting yafo at all after this experience

HNPlWvaQpaoXoNMutIgIvg.text: I had the pleasure of trying out Yafo and was very pleased with not only the food but the excellent service. Lady K was very helpful with explaining the different menu options and checked on my table frequently to make sure that both me and my guest were okay. P.s. this is a great place with tons of vegan and vegetarian options

KrC5MsE1IDyLgcc5f_K3oQ.text: This Yafo is in Plaza has been highly anticipated. The parking can be a little troublesome, but it's always worth it. The food is very consistent among the different locations and it's always good. The lamb, hummus and other accruements are always freshly made.   This is one of my favorite fast-casual meals in the city.

q-EXAfjeAadjssmeLpiF7Q.text: Fresh, healthy, fast, and delicious food, with lots of options. And the prices were fair, too. It's not a fancy, sit down restaurant. But if you're okay with a super casual setting, it'll work just fine.

UcBFmvfb-47lzdd8JBAgKg.text: Deeee-lishious healthy alternative to the everyday mundane meals. If you are vegan Ron will hook you up with perfect choices

ff8VFPWmzxXXrUNDrXNoDQ.text: I had an overall good experience at YAFO. I built my own bowl with a few different toppings and everything I had tasted great: hummus, tabouleh, beats, quinoa salad, cucumber & tomato salad, and purple cabbage slaw. I also ordered a kids chicken & rice meal which the cashier did not give me my drink or cookie so I had to go back and my child complained that the chicken was too spicy, hence the four stars but this is definitely a "must try" place if your looking for Mediterranean and something fresh. I

tQDUXO3GUxpOGSxgfbAnZw.text: I went to Yafo for the first time last week after hearing good things about it. It's a cute place and served the best brussels sprouts I've ever had! I very much appreciate the vegetarian options (and vegan and gluten free items are identified on the menu as well).

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. falafel wrap and brussels sprouts
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken with cauliflower and brussels sprouts and a falafel wrap and brussels sprouts

BPxR6h2q8BKkjH0go_B6cQ.text: Thankful my long-distance relationship with Yafo is over! Fresh. Friendly. Fantastic.  Like many fast casual dining establishments--there are so many options when you begin to consider all the ways you can mix and match--the set dishes can be a great first experience approach, but once you get the hang of it, the freedom to choose is liberating. My go to is always half kale and spinach and half grain bowl. With toppings a mile long, there is something for everyone to enjoy--even for those with a vegetarian and vegan diet.  The parking lot is a whole different story--hold your breath as you squeeze into the compact car spots and double check the backup camera as you put it in reverse as you say "see you soon" and cruise out of the lot.

kBnINol7rFjlFosVKbRSyA.text: Just as good as the Sharon Rd location. Super fresh, designated parking, fully customizeable.

80D0o37up1-O4uB1RnHhKg.text: Yafo! You made my dreams come True. I like Cava too, but I like Yafo better because they're less restrictive when it comes to toppings. The seasonal mezze was really good too.

R6rVC37DZEnoKbSkQ14T7w.text: I'm a huge Yafo fan and was thrilled to see this new location pop up in Plaza Midwood. First off, the thing that sets Yafo apart from so many other fast casual places is that they use all fresh ingredients and make everything from scratch every single day! I highly recommend getting half hummus, half couscous, sampling the various salads, adding tazazki sauce, feta, stuffed grape leaves, and adding some sauces on the side. Don't forget the airy and delectable laffah bread as well! You will not be disappointed in this establishment. Perhaps Mediterranean food is not your thing. Just try it! This is absolutely amazing and fresh and everyone should give it a shot!!

LutFLg-Hjp1GcSBqkCj29A.text: ok, the food was great but I kept wondering why everyone else in the place had huge bowls and we were handed a bag and the wrap was half the size of everyone who was there. First we were asked if we were dining in. When we say yes, that usually means we are eating there.  Then when they bring us our bag to the table, we notice no hummus on our wrap and my daughter goes up to ask why. she said oh yes, I see a smear here. Hello. For 11.00 for a wrap you should have more that 1/3 a teaspoon and 5 little chick peas. Like I said I would just think you place was cheap except for the other 6 people who where dining in and the amounts on the plates and in their wraps. Something is wrong. We actually stopped here because of the good reviews and were just a bit disappointed. I hope it was not unconscious bias on how we were served...hummmm

Q3WcWE2eXWU70a996dqxXQ.text: Great concept! Food is fresh and tasty and service is friendly and efficient. Perfect fast casual spot and also good for takeout (can order/pay online). I usually get the Galilee Kofta which is delicious. Highly recommend. They now have a total of three locations (PM, Dilworth and Southpark) which is a testament to their great food.

zDPp_fZTYM-GuhuDnihezA.text: Really good spot to go for a quick and light lunch. I really enjoyed the options and the variety of Mediterranean ingredients.  I ordered a quinoa falafel bowl with a garlic tahini sauce, which was really tasty and felt healthy with all the fresh ingredients. Definitely worth coming back!

Sp0t6yl-MzgUOYWmMHFtOg.text: Alright, I'm not going to lie... I'm not sure exactly what I ended up ordering, but it was delicious. This place can be a little intimidating for a first timer but the team members are overly knowledgeable when it comes to their product. Think: if Chipotle went Mediterranean. There are tons of options for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians. I went with a bowl and kind of let one of the staff members do their thing because I had no clue how to navigate the menu. Tim was the most helpful person I've met in a long time and clearly had a drive for customer service. Staff members went above and beyond to make sure everyone enjoyed their food and their experience.

Guo3uk4UbFc0mSJol77bBQ.text: I love Yafo and am so excited to have another fast casual option in my hood. I have been to this location 3x already and can't imagine any reason why I wouldn't be back soon. Think Chipotle in terms of the ordering process. You go down the line and tell them what to add to your dish. I like that you can make your own bowl/wrap/salad but they also have some preconceived options in case. My protein go-to is the shwarma chicken. YUM! Also a huge fan of the brussel sprouts. They are delicious. They have some great lemonades and teas that are made in house. The line can be really long, but food is done quickly.

TrUc6UIbOajPVlKr_VdAZw.text: Love this place. Have not had a bad meal there. I get a falafel wrap. It's so big I should only eat half of it, but it's so good that I can never stop eating it until it's gone. The sides are generous and all delicious.

qJnGz2HnqEOKbKO9VhvrwA.text: Is it possible that Yafo 2.0 is better than the original? We love the original by SouthPark and this one is a little bit closer to us so we are thrilled. The line was long but moved quickly, like usual. I would recommend trying the rotisserie pork, if you want to try something different. Our food was delicious, fresh and craveable. I love their macncheese, don't skip it! If you're skeptical it's made with yogurt, put your judgement aside and just order it. Parking was kind of tough but isn't it always tough in Plaza? Also, I wish they sold mixed drinks made with their house juices. They're just begging for a little rum! Maybe I need to take my food to go next time and doctor it a little at home.

GRnioHKymHoCaPsHQRKLlw.text: One thing that's good about this place is when you're going through the line you have 6/7 people up there to help.  Makes it a lot better when you're putting your meal together.    We're talking about restaurant quality food at this place, no if ands or buts about it. Everything fresh, everything cooked, premium choices to choose Gets the highly critical seal of approval from me.  Two recommendations for the owner/management: the rinky dink 1975 soda fountain needs to be upgraded and if possible, parking is damn well near a nightmare.

XzJ4n1nQCziOFPiOzhovAQ.text: Perfect spot for a fast and more importantly delicious and healthy meal. I loved the babaganoush and the hummus was divine. The cauliflower is also amazing. Next level on taste for everything. Proportions were also generous. The staff were all friendly and attentive and Lady K was super awesome, taking care of us during our meal. Wish I had one in my city (San Francisco)!

Wq6W3Wl73eIsBBk69f8zBw.text: Wow!!!  I absolutely loved, loved, loved this place.  I unfortunately am not local so it will have to be one of those places I visit when in Charlotte.  I got the half and half with rice and had them add tons of things.  My favorite was the hummus and cauliflower!!

XLACJLhZM_iMQWWz-ekA8w.text: The Mac and Cheese is worth dying for.  Ok, so even if you order one of their signature dishes to get away from making a million choices, you still have to make choices about sides and extra protein etc.  I like how custom the menu can be, but I also don't like making a million choices.  My food was beyond amazing.  I left full but not feeling regretful for making unhealthy choices.  The food was fresh and packed with healthy ingredients.  Oh, the sweet tea with mango was phenomenal.  I can't wait to go back just for the tea.  The servers were patient with us as we figured out the menu, which I appreciate way more than they realize.  I can tell they have been trained well!!  I will certainly go back!  This visit was on accident because we didn't want to wait 45 mins at Midwood Smokehouse next door.  It was a very happy surprise visit and we will certainly be back.

nAT8HhXZdpp_LbwnCh0aXg.text: Excited Yafo is in Plaza Midwood, same great food and service. I would say this location does not have a lot of indoor seating, but plenty of seating indoors. Be aware that Plaza Midwood can be a hard place to park. This location has take out/order ahead should you want to take yours to go.  If you didn't know Yafo is an amazing Mediterranean/Middle Easter restaurant, where you get in line, and order what you want on the other side of glass. They work very quickly so don't be intimidated by long lines.   I tell people this is a great place to go if they want to try something new, or if they have people with them with allergies. Yafo's menu has a lot to choose from for people with special dietary needs.  Everything I've tried is really good, especially the bread. I love that you can customize things to what you want and everything isn't fried .   Glad this franchise is branching out in Charlotte, NC.

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lamb &amp; Chicken Wrap
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Shawarma &amp; Brussels Sprouts
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

sDBSeHREGKAgiiRyj3PxAw.text: Yahoo for Yafo! Consider me a BIG fan especially since I refused to believe the hype, if you will. I was wrong to pass judgement.  A recent Tuesday evening, I had a meeting in the area and decided this was an opportune time to finally try Yafo. Yafo is located directly across the street from Midwood Smokehouse and is brightly colored with a gray and green exterior. There's a designated parking lot but I can imagine that it gets very tight during peak times. Thankfully, I visited around 5:30 and it was not busy at all. I was able to walk right up to the counter without a line and order!  Since I was a newbie, I figured I would go with one of the signature menu items - the Chicken Shawarma wrap. I struggled with choosing a side because they all looked so delicious but, ultimately, decided on the roasted cauliflower with lemon tahini sauce. I also ordered a beverage with my meal and my total came to $14 plus change. Not bad at all considering I had leftovers for my lunch the next day.  For my beverage, I decided to mix their cool mint lime and lemonade which produced a refreshing, slightly sweet/tart beverage. BIG FAN. I sat down and dug in. The chicken was so juicy and the seasoning was on point. The pita wrap was warm and doughy. I could do some damage if I had a stack of those wraps. The cauliflower was roasted just right and the lemon tahini sauce just took it to the next level. If you order the cauliflower, you must get the sauce. Trust me.  I look forward to going back multiple times and creating my own bowls/salads!

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Exterior
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken shwarma wrap

-WjKMU5QC3kEb3K-HpfZrw.text: Overall great spot for a healthy but delicious lunch.   I wouldn't recommend the limeade but everything else was tasty and well seasoned.

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetarian Rice Bowl

nakhnZV75-M-1j75AJ1Kxg.text: I love their food! But what's the deal with always running out of falafel and me constantly having to wait for you to make more? This happens in the restaurant and for mobile orders regularly.   Tonight I mobile ordered and it says my order will be ready in 20 minutes. I head to Yafo and on the way, I receive a text saying my order is ready so I head in. I then get inside and they tell me they are "just waiting on falafel". I wait over 10 minutes for the falafel. When I get my food it's been over 30 minutes since I ordered, but the food was stated to be "ready in 20 minutes". Why have mobile ordering if I still have to wait? This is an issue they need to address.

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

noJ2fliRfkKd14Jl9uhwtw.text: Love everything about Yafo. The fast casual is great for those busy lunch hours or a quick dinner and you can taste the freshness in the ingredients!   I love getting the bowl with two different bases, all of which are delicious but I think their hummus has an excellent creaminess to it, as well as the baba ganoush, but you can also get grains or lettuce. Then the best part, choosing from all the fresh toppings. There's too many to list here! I usually get the chicken on top of mine, but they have a variety of other meats and veggie options. And to top it off the bowl comes with a homemade, nice and warm pita like bread! So good.  The bowl is usually enough for two meals for me!  You can also order the rotisserie chicken with sides. The Mac n cheese is good and made with Greek yogurt, but the Brussels are my fav!   They also serve beers, ciders and wine (and even have some on tap!). And this location is pretty big on the inside, so finding a table is no problem!

WpKPITwcgWvzcTImLPbH8g.text: So thankful that Yafo has opened up in our neighborhood!  In the winter (southern) season of heavy casseroles, it's  great having a fast-casual spot nearby that is both delicious and healthy! I'd suggest opting to build your own bowl and add as many fresh ingredients as possible. I usually get salad/cous cous combo with a hummus spread and then add ALL the veggies. This is one place where a meat is not needed to make the dish flavorful or filling. Try their chickpea salad or roasted beets! I'm a big fan of their spicy red schug, too. If you like it hot, his sauce is a must!  Also, if you're close by, try to walk there...parking can get tricky during busy hours (same could be said for most every business in PM).

iqKj9CEvs-LGHjv2Smy1yw.text: I've been to the south park location of Yafo and thought my order was rushed because I really didn't know what I was doing or ordering. This time around I went with a group of friends and was given a couple of recommendations.   Most of their options can be made as bowl, salad or wrap. The pita bread is made on site and you can see it being made as you are in line.  I went with the Marrakesh Lamb wrap. All I have to say is wow! All the flavors in this wrap had a party and danced in my mouth. Adding the spicy sauces (Schug) made it even more amazing. I had to use their garlic sauce to cool down my mouth.  Besides the line options, they also have a large fountain drink selection and a bar for 3 additional sauces.   I honestly can't wait to come back and try something else on their menu. The only thing stopping me is this place gets busy. I've seen lines out the door. So probably best to come on off hours.

eJIS8KR5twnOSUYN1NDboQ.text: Yafo is great! I got a bowl with grains and greens mixed. I was glad I can get unlimited toppings of veggies. The portions are huge and more then enough for a meal. It also comes with fresh pita that comes warm. I got chicken in the bowl which was delicious. The falafels looks good as well. The set up was easy to navigate as it showed me which veggies and sides I could add in my bowl. The juices are also great as my favorite was the cardamon vanilla cider. Yafo is very similar to CAVA but they have a different taste and a little larger veggie section.

iuxPWHVFNAZtTfghWbwDqA.text: Stop by for lunch, build your own bowl!! Endless choices, salads, proteins, and veggies! Great vegetarian choices!! Veg head for life. Customer service was patient as it was my first time. They went through  each item with me so I ended up with the perfect bowl!! BTW portions are generous enough to take home for another meal. If it is your first time here I recommend getting the menu walking through the line to visually see the options available, then going through a second time. It was an amazing,healthy, and extremely tasteful meal. Let's talk drinks. Next to the fountain machine where soft drinks are served,  there are paper cones, take one and try all the specialty beverages such as love potion. My favorite  the lime coconut mint!!  There  are Gender neutral, hands free,  bathroom  Enjoy!!! Can't wait to come again!!#goodsftuff#vegheadforlife#

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beverages
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amazing combination of drinks
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Snacks

ECLY5NL8pEv18WPyhSblzw.text: My first few trips to Yafo were a bit overwhelming and I am not sure why! If you haven't been it is like any other of the casual dinning meets fast food place like Moes, and Zoes etc but for whatever reason their set up seems more confusing to me. Maybe it is because they do have some set dishes and then some build your own.  The location in Plaza is a nice addition to the area and I love that they having a little bit of parking.  If you park in one of the front spots make sure to pull all the way up in the spots so others cars can get through.  The best part of Yafo is their menu is great for anyone who has dietary issues from vegetarians and gluten free,  to vegans and low carb folks.   My favorite items  are the their Brussel sprouts, MAC and Cheese, Beets and their Falafel.

fWSnasHCpqoPZT75_V4LNg.text: I stopped in for dinner today with my fiance and another couple. The food was great! I got a 1/2 salad 1/2 rice bowl with a ton of toppings and chicken. I could taste that the food was fresh. I also got their cucumber and mint drink which was amazing! The service was fast and friendly. There are a ton of options. People with different dietary needs and preferences can all find something to enjoy here. And it's definitely on the healthier side when eating out! We'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

R6o-OGx_1u2XZ3LEnAkrrw.text: Fresh is the best way to describe the food and environment with the bright fresh colors as you walk in. I didn't know what to expect when I walked in but I'm glad I went . The staff was over the top friendly the manager even stopped by my table for chit chat and future suggestions. I chose the shrawma chicken wrap and roasted cauliflower. The cucumber lime mint lemonade topped it all of. If this place wasn't so far I would probly find myself here every day!!! I forgot to mention how the line was out the door it moved quickly and well worth the wait .

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

CWN5lqSrh-ZKmE6XVIFk4w.text: I was so excited for Yafo to come to Plaza Midwood and it's lived up! The staff here is very friendly and FAST. If there's no line, you can have your food in five minutes - YEAH! The line can definitely build up but it moves quickly. They have so many people behind the counter at all times.  There is a lot of seating available - sadly no tables outside, though there are chairs.   Order from the menu or build your own - just watch out that the proteins all run $2 a pop, which is pretty pricey on a bowl that starts at $8.99. This is definitely not the cheapest option in Plaza but you do get a fair amount of food. Lots of vegan and vegetarian options. Get the Granch dressing!

HQZhySVfZ0sKfDXGD9YOBg.text: I love this food so much - I order it weekly.  The food is soooo fresh and healthy, you feel great about eating it while loving how it tastes.    I usually order a make your own bowl - and love all the ingredients.  Unless there's something you know you'll not eat, I would encourage you to get most everything!  I always get the chicken as my protein - it's so flavorful!  Grab some cilantro yogurt dressing to drizzle over the top - you will NOT be disappointed.

GfuOMe29jTV5qLZuBE3fbQ.text: OMG!  I am in trouble!  This place is right next to my office.  I can literally see it from my desk, and I. Am. In. Love.  I'm talkin' like three to four times a week for lunch y'all.  The struggle is so real!  I may or may not have eaten there today.  #nocomment  This is the second of two Yafo locations in Charlotte.  Yafo is a "fast-casual" Greek/Mediterranean inspired restaurant.  Much like Subway or Chipotle, you go down the line to customize your entree and proceed to the register.  After checkout you fill your beverage cup and either head on your way or seat yourself at an available table.  There is no table service, though they will offer to clear your table of trash or top off your drink.  Once you are done, leave any dishes on your table and their dining room attendant will clear them for you.  Shawarma and hummus are my goto options here.  The hummus bowl is out of this world!  They also offer salads, lamb, etc.  The mac and cheese has a different twist, made with large shells and topped with a dollop of sour cream.  There are several unique drink options as well.  Try the coconut!  All entrees are served with a side of fresh pita bread.  Parking seems limited at first glance, but there are two hour spaces behind the building and the first floor of the parking garage at the adjacent apartment community is reserved for retail patrons.

ZwdqFL6S9cGNgnz8VQskEw.text: I had the privilege of enjoying this fast casual Mediterranean restaurant on New Years Eve and it was amazing. The base bowl is $8.99 and  $2 or  $3 extra deep song in the preotei. You choose. To start you choose if you want a salad, wrap, or grain and then build with the variety of toppings. I thoroughly enjoyed my falafel salad with all the wonderful toppings. It also comes with pita bread. I had enough leftover for dinner. The next time I'm I  Charlotte I would like to return.

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Falafel salad

80gGQvCiVCNjh0kYqyEHew.text: Terrible experience. I ordered from a delivery app. The salad was wrong. I paid extra to get both chicken Shawarma and Kafka.  Shawarma was missing and Kafka was rare.  Update:  The store reached out to me, apologized, and even offered to reach out to the service to get me a refund.  I have had positive experiences in the past so I will upgrade the review to 3 stars.  Everyone can make a mistake.

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kafta, raw!

oiLVbEz-L8CQNhlyWMJG-Q.text: This place is great if you're looking to eat healthy. My current diet is gluten free, low carb, and high in healthy fats. Yafo, with its hummus, avocado, rice, and other options makes it easy to eat clean.   On top of that they have friendly staff, comfortable seating, and are relatively affordable.

uEFz7uvVtg9BNf4Odw3cfQ.text: Probably favorite restaurant for lunch or a quick bowl to go for dinner! Go here once a week definitely recommend favorite is the half greens half rice bowl with lamb.

LdOyT-Wn9B6LWECKJNHFpQ.text: The first thing about this place is the fresh oven baked pitas!  Excellent choices for a Build your Own stuff!  The food tastes fresh and excellent sauces to go with it!  It's good quantity for the buck and the one in The Plaza also has an excellent seating arrangement! For those looking to hang out and eat healthy at the same time, this one's definitely a great choice.

r4KYMxb8FbNemAx8iB9_5A.text: Another terrific Yafo experience. We got bowls and you can add endless things to them. We love the half salad half hummus bowl and you can get all kinds of toppings.  I highly recommend getting pita too. It's warm and so nice.  Finally, the sauces are great but be careful with the really spicy one. It's insane but great!

TCCOyo-GRFRS9dEBKfnGWQ.text: We were obsessed with Yafo's falafel, but the last few times we have gone it hasn't been good. We go only for the falafel (and incredible sauces!) and were totally hooked on it since the first South Park location opened.   We used to drive across town for it because it was just that good. What made it so special and worth driving for was that the falafel were small, extra crispy, and flavorful.   So when the new location in PM opened we were there every week. Then a few weeks or so ago the falafel suddenly changed - totally different than it's been since they first opened.   The patties are much bigger, and the texture is very mushy and off-putting now. We usually both get the wrap, but with the big falafel there is just not enough crispiness to prevent the wrap from becoming a big lukewarm, gushy mess. Like eating a pasty burrito.   The falafel also don't taste as flavorful, but that could just be because you get less tasty fried surface area. We've given it a few shots but it's just not as good. The rest of the menu is probably good but I can only speak of the falafel. Used to be the best, now below average.  If they ever go back to their original falafel (pleeeease!) I will happily update this review. In the meantime, I can't recommend Yafo anymore.

MPhMBdoEXQQlsLMpKQauzw.text: I might be jumping the gun by slapping a five-star rating on this "fast casual" Med restaurant after a single visit.  But this was the best bang for the buck I'd ever experienced in a fast-casual restaurant, and one of the best I'd experienced in any restaurant in years, period.    Ten dollars gets your FOUR mezze, i.e., appetizers.  The restaurant did not skimp on portions, and the quality was as high or higher than in plenty of table-service Mediterranean places.  (The wife and I are Anglo-Celtic natives of the American South who sure didn't grow up with such fare and don't pretend to be experts, but at the same time we are long-time Med/Middle Eastern/Lebanese food freaks and have been to our share of such restaurants.)  Had tabbouleh, baba ghanouj, a chickpea salad, and falafel.  Everything was fresh and terrific and flavorful.  My only complaints are nit-picky:  Tabbouleh had a higher bulgur ratio than I'd prefer (gimme that parsley), and a little salty, and the baba ghanouj was also a bit salty.    An mezze outlay of this quality and quantity would probably set you back 20 or 25 dollars at a table-service restaurant.     The world needs more YAFOs.

hGR626729v3I2XVImf5VKw.text: I went here for a yelp elite event but that's not only why I am giving such a high rating. Until I went to this event I never even tried Hummus before & surprisingly I really enjoyed it. The staff was great. I didn't realize this good had as many health benefits as it did. I would definitely come back & i think it's worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

kIAGvRWbxKHhnay4SDrJNQ.text: Love my half greens half grain falafel bowl! Incredible flavors! Awesome drink options with cider, wine, beer, juice. Interior is modern and clean and nice casual dining feel. Great location near uptown but don't park across the street or you'll get booted.   I had 2 meals from this so ask for a to go bowl. I ordered a little of everything available to add on and it was perfect. Beets, cabbage, babaganoush was amazing, give me all the veggies! The garlic aioli drizzle is delicious too. Love that we also got a huge pita bread.   If you like Mediterranean don't miss this cool concept of built your own bowl!

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cucumber lime mint is amazing!
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Awesome falafel
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yummy juices

uIFrTrSs6yLSOkKnTc_VpQ.text: Finally tried YAFO Kitchen after hearing great things about this place. I really enjoyed it! Lots of options and everything was super fresh.   I ordered the chicken shawarma bowl and added extra toppings. I wish they gave a bigger scoop of the chicken.   Next time I will ask for the tzatziki on the side, less rice in the bowl, and add more of the fresh toppings (cucumbers, tomatoes, etc.)  Parking is limited. Don't park across the street in the grocery store parking lot or you might get towed.

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

XgrU-sn0wtyLq7Ys8tfBfQ.text: I was intimidated by Yafo because I wasn't sure what to order. I love Hummus though and am so happy I went in to eat. I had the hummus bowl and added various toppings on top. I bought pita chips to dip in the meal and it was insanely delicious and a large portion. I had a enough to take home for a second meal!

4MgB8BC3z4bFiE01cCyi7Q.text: My favorite place to pick up a meal when traveling to Charlotte. The food is always great. Love the flavor and quality of all the food I have eaten here. I love adding the beets to my salads. Parking maybe a little tricky but the food is worth the effort.

PUaxalqZdsAityYA94gNXQ.text: Count me in guys! So happy they have another location! Yafo does it again. I'm just a big fan all around!  Brought the whole family this time - the Chicken Schwarma bowl is my favorite - throw in that Tzatziki - pickled onions - throw it all in! Keep it coming! The chicken is super tender and so well seasoned. I'm in love with the Toum (Garlic) sauce as well.  So the kids meals are only $5.99 - hand crafted mac and cheese with chicken on top - plus a cookie and drink. I tried the mac - rich - toasty and amped up with the Schwarma. Total deal!  I'm also addicted to the Mezze - the Hummus is like silk - delicious silk - the tabouleh salad - so fresh and tasty. And who doesn't love that house made Laffah?   I could eat there every day of the week - tons of variety - lots of flavors - food you can recognize! I know - I probably used too many exclamation points in this review but Yafo deserves a 5 pound bag of them!!!

t9joyPgjS-LNs_TKA6SZcA.text: I honestly come here about once a week, and don't ever get tired of it. From ordering grain bowls, salads, or just a large thing of (the best) mac and cheese, there's always something new to try, and it's all delicious. I love that they tell you where they source their meats/veggies from - supporting local/small businesses makes me feel better about the amount of mac and cheese I'm eating... Overall, a great place for a quick meal and so happy they're in Plaza Midwood!

PjwP1Npmg6ISHCcBTN7ozg.text: We've been to Yafo in South Park, but it's a long way to travel, so we don't go often.  We happened to be in Plaza Midwood for lunch one weekday, and decided to try this relatively new location.    Parking is sufficient now, but I can only imagine the difficulty parking in this small lot when Snooze opens later in June.  And there's a note on the door not to park across the street in the Organic Harvest lot, or risk getting booted.  Just be careful when parking here.  Onto the food....my husband and I both ordered their salad bowls.  I used spinach and added cucumbers, tomatoes, babaganoush, hummus, falafel, and lemon tahini.  My husband got grilled chicken on his.  They serve their bowls with delicious warm bread.  While I'm trying to limit my intake of white bread, I did have a few bites, and it was just lovely.  They made my falafel fresh and it was outstanding.  So much better than Cava's falafel!  Their hummus and baba are also delicious - both having a fresh lemony flavor.  We both enjoyed our lunch very much.  Yafo is a bit pricey, hence only four stars for me.  Our two bowls with tap water were $23.85.  Regardless, it was a delicious lunch, however, and we'll absolutely be back.

EjIR_0p1DmUi9lOt0JtH4A.text: Yafo takes home the prize vs Cava in the great debate for the new fresh, fast casual and healthier eating!   Yafo was so fresh and good as I went with the half and half option in which I really like a lot. You can choose two bases to put everything on and it is perfect for people who can't decide. I think it is pretty affordable for the quality of the food.   I would go to Yafo before Chipotle any day now as I don't feel guilty ! The food is high quality and they have a lot of options to choose from in order to build your perfect bowl, salad or wrap.   I really enjoy all the toppings I got to choose from as my bowl looked so green and healthy! I think Yafo has great add ons as well and the simple process gets to the point in a good way!   Yafo over Cava. You be the judge ...

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half and half salad and grain chicken and veggie bowl!!

jHNSj-kllhM3V2DUOO2F3g.text: This location seems to always be bumping for dinner, so I recommend to call your order in and then go to pick up. Even if you're planning on eating there - its the same container anyway.  Parking is also tough, so you might need to walk a bit. The front lot is not ideal for cars over compact size.  Food - Chipotle style where you order your base and then toppings follow. This allows you to really customize your choice to your pallet, I love this part.   Really, I've tried all the combos, but the hummus and rice combo as the base is one of my favorites, it's the right amount of both to not overwhelm the other flavors.   I try to get as many veggies as possible, they all have good flavor and what you'd expect out of mediterranean style common dishes found around the US. This consistency is something I am a fan of.   Meats, I prefer the lamb as it has a lot of flavor. Can be a little greasy, but I think it's still by far the best.   At checkout you can get a spicy green oil based sauce to pour over the top, I recommend that for the extra (big) kick.   People are nice but assumptive that you've been to their establishment before (there are other locations in Charlotte). Just be sure to explain if its your first time and you'd like help or else they will just look at you and wait for you to tell them what to do. :)  It seems clean, the decor is nice and there are lots of tables. Absolutely love all the YAFO's!

JLXHzakaknoFUJRlVO5yeQ.text: I don't like chain restaurants, but I went anyway so I can't really complain about that but it was yummy! It was enjoyable to watch them make the wraps in front of you and squish the dough. The pulled lamb was delicious but a bit too liquidly for a wrap. The fun drinks you can get like coconut lime was awesome, and probably my favorite part. The biggest issue is the price, with 3 rice bowls and one wrap, and 4 drinks it came out to be 60 bucks. For a "fast" food place I don't recommend going here to save money. Basically it's a chipotle of Mediterranean food.

VbFgaxx6ZbI1rjjvFjRTuw.text: I dropped in for lunch and the place was empty was assisted by knowledgeable staff and decided to create my own bowl you get to pick your protein and it's located in a trendy neighborhood. I recommend getting the Greek yogurt Mac and cheese!

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Create your own bowl

eOvom69RSg9obc0QEPjGIw.text: I am so so excited Yafo opened up a location in Plaza Midwood because it is walking distance from where I live. This restaurant is amazing!! Everything always tastes super fresh and it's counter service so you get your food really fast. The staff is friendly and will let you try samples of the different bowl toppings. I did this the first time I ate here because I wasn't sure what I would like (and I ended up liking everything I tried).   My go to order is a build your own bowl. I do half hummus and half spinach as my base. The toppings I use vary but some of my favorites are the sumac onions, cucumber and tomato salad, and chickpea and roasted pepper salad. I top my bowl off with some falafel and it is an incredibly filling and delicious vegetarian meal.   This is something we eat multiple times a month because of the speed, convenience, and affordability. Definitely check this place out, you won't be disappointed!

6ADzPbq4j5H3Lz0bEGzx2w.text: This place is GREAT! So many choices, all of them good.fast friendly service, courteous staff, clean dining room. The pita bread is just delicious. All the humus and other dips are wonderful. The bowls are my thing and they do them well. Off course I did build it myself, lol.  The only down side is the noise level at a busy lunch time. lots of hard surfaces=increases in volume of conversations.

4pfFtAB140A3UuEqTcEShg.text: Yafo Kitchen is soooo good. Their hummus had me dipping everything in it. They have tasty sides such as the Greek yogurt Mac and cheese and falafel. They also have family meals that include three sides and a full rotisserie chicken all for under 30. You can make build your own bowls which is perfect for a good lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Greek Greek Yogurt Mac n&#39; Cheese
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hummus

uV0bVMnwFpXuzyin9suofg.text: First time here was a little overwhelming Simply because it is a new experience for me the menu is full of great healthy options.  the staff is friendly and willing to help if it's your first time the bathrooms appear to be clean all the time, they are unisex bathrooms as well. This place would be good for a casual lunch or dinner option don't really consider it first date or second date I also would not recommend this for a family dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States. Build your own grain bowl

ZiDU28xUlWjmceCw2AExJA.text: I love this place!! The idea of getting healthy, fresh flavors just as quickly as you would a burger or pizza , you won't feel guilty about is amazing. Too much of anything is never any good but indulging here is not one you will regret.   The overall vibe is modern as is the approach in way of the ordering process. You walk up, you can order straight off their menu or with so many choices of sides, you customized to your taste.   I ordered the falafel on a pita with the red pickled onions and no pickles. I got a side of the cilantro dressing, it was amazing. They do have other sauces to choose from and all the options are fantastic. The side of roasts cauliflower was DEVINE, light, flavorful and waistline friendly . My friend ordered the falafel the way it was on the menu, in a bowl with couscous.   I can't wait to go back and try more items, well done!!!

photos.caption: Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of YAFO Kitchen - Charlotte, NC, United States

uihJrrd3r-YiHI0s9DHd7A.text: Excellent place, healthy meals, huge portion, lots of choices.  Always busy.  Something different compared our usual fast food places.

nLFdkj7X3hBhMoCvJnx_PA.text: First time here and was not disappointed. The staff was nice and friendly. The parking wasn't horrible. The food was pretty good. I can't really say anything was bad.

_fWIBkATJdPUTmq7KEEq2A.text: Excited to have a new place in the hood with delicious food! The place looks great and fits in perfectly with Plaza-Midwood!

yjXiOye1BNw0mBKM9N_Uag.text: EXCELLENT service!!!! Fresh ingredients and the staff is very friendly! Kanisha is always so attentive and makes it her duty to make sure customers are enjoying their visit!!! Overall this place is my Go to spot for lunch! Never fails me.

fvAifIdDWyeovzA603ZbHA.text: So good! I had a 5 hour layover waiting for coworkers to come to town and I stopped by Yafo because I like to eat as healthy as possible on the road, and I'm vegetarian. It was perfect. I make really healthy food at home and it exceeded my expectations. Great service, clean restaurant area, and really delicious bowl with a lot of options. I had a greens bowl with baba ghanoush and hummus plus falafel. I usually expect to pay more for extra sauces and toppings but everything I got was included. Sooo delicious. I wish we had more options like this in WA state. And the chef/manager came out to make sure everything was good and asked what could be done to improve my meal. I couldn't think of anything!! This place is bomb. If I lived here I would be in all the time!  Only thing I would improve as always is organic produce and sustainable drinks are and to go containers.

JX7ZgWat3SN9YFYW6H8pTg.text: Yum.   It was tremendously tasty with interesting interior details.   Will be back.   Wish one was in Steele Crek

tV_YkjiC3xOfaRFE3ojQsw.text: The Greek style food is great, juices are different but good.   I've been 5 times since they opened.   Yafo offers a new and exciting dining experience for lunch and a quick dinner.

ujGSGLLsS9Xe_Ks5xZy8MA.text: I fell in love at first, but every time I go back the service gets worse and worse. Tonight my food had to be remade TWICE bc of careless mistakes by the line workers after waiting over 20 minutes in a very short line. I won't be back for a while

_c2L-IcW8jTnmhsTwXa8_w.text: Love this new place. They have great food. I already went to the location in South Park so I am excited we have one here in Plaza Midwood now.

Z-geNUCVmkX-VzlEIW7MHQ.text: This place is the greatest!! Super friendly and knowledgeable staff. Everything is always fresh and delicious!! So happy with this addition to the neighborhood!!

asN10qE7yAZh6tmqKjvqow.text: great bowls. I've had the Galilee kofta twice & definitely recommend it. Garlic sauce is also good with the pita.

4lX1jeFX9z5neTKGD-chNQ.text: We recently ate at Cava and while Yafo was good and staff was helpful the flavors at Cava popped and I didn't get that at Yafo. It was all fresh and tasted good. The staff took it from a 3.5 to 4.

lBHF3xX1rCECHcGRclzX_g.text: Amazingggggggg food. Best quality and great survive. I am a life time customer from here on out!!!

skHRWP07sRFvEaYuxAw9yw.text: We've been at the other location in south park.. Very disappointed two times, we was thinking that new location will probably be better, but no.. We like Mediterranean food but it's not even close.. Doesn't teast like Mediterranean, got 3 stars only because they fast and nice but if you looking for real Mediterranean food that's not the right place for you.

cSPmVzsUtkSH4Gy6-Nkk-A.text: Good food & decent prices on them. There's a good variety for whatever your tastes or diet. Just try it. You'll like it
